Opposite wall of his bed was the bathroom with the door opened.

Michelangelo, or Mikey for short as he was usually called by his brothers, looked over at the clock to see 11:00AM in bright red letters and numbers. This definitely caused him to jump out of bed. “Oh dude! I’m late for training!” he said as he went to closet to get his nunchucks and ninja, but suddenly stopped and came to a realization. Usually when he overslept, one of his brothers, most often Raphael, comes down to his room and wakes him up. Family training always started at 10:30 so why didn’t anyone come by then? It was an oddity.

Maybe they decided to start later? Or maybe Raph is trying to prank me by not waking me up on time because he is a mondo grump?

He then proceeded to put on his usual ninja garb and headed to the dojo area, just to be sure. He left his room, went left and out of the hallway into the main lair, and took another left into the room where the exercise room and dojo area. It was circular room with many stone block arches surrounding a blue matted dojo arena. Also, surrounding the arena were many exercising machines, like treadmills, Stairmasters, and ellipticals along with sets of dumbbells and barbells next to them. There were also racks of both fake and real weapons like katanas, spears, etc. and training dummies with some having battle scars by sharp weapons. Yet the thing that was missing from the training grounds was his family.

“Huh? They’re not here?” he said while scratching his head. Maybe it has been cancelled and they’re still in their rooms? He thought as he backtracked towards the hallway and knocked on the room door that was across from his, Raphael’s.

“Raph, you in here?!” he said as he knocked first, and then opened the door just to see an empty room containing some dumbbells and barbells and a punching bag with Mikey’s face taped onto it, not surprising considering the ‘red’ turtle’s muscle headed nature. A bed lay neatly in the back, which was kind of odd, while a closet containing his weapons and ninja gear occupied the right side of the room. With a puzzled expression, he closed the door and went to Leonardo’s room next door to Raph’s.

“Yo Leo!” he called into another empty room that was oriental inspired. The floor had woven mats, the walls had some posters with Japanese symbols and words and art pictures that depicted warriors in battle. There was a shelf of books that had plenty of books ranging from novels to self-help books to meditation guides to weapon catalogs. Like before, a neatly made bed and a closet containing ninja gear with swords on a rack. With a bit of an annoyed face, he closed the door and went across the hall towards Donny’s room.

“Donny?” he said as peeked into his genius of a brother’s room. It was kind of similar to Mikey’s except more of a techno-geek’s paradise or a mad scientist’s room. It had a computer station that was much larger than his with multiple monitors and screens, more wires than he can count attached to multiple towers and keyboards. There was a table that was filled with schematics and machine parts used for making technology in the battle against their enemies and for plain tinkering. Another table next to it had a chemist lab with test tubes and beakers filled with multicolored liquids, microscopes, a couple of notebooks, and petri dishes. A made bed occupied a corner of the room with a closet containing Don’s signature weapon, the bo staff. Mikey hurriedly closed the door and went towards the end of the hall where Splinter’s room is.

“Sensei?” he said as he swung the door wide open to his father’s room which was twice if not three times the size of his and his brothers’. The room was like Leo’s with an oriental flair with similar items. There were plenty of posters with Japanese words and characters that had motivational meanings and pictures depicting warriors amongst bamboo, emperors and ladies in kimonos, and etc. There were a couple of glass door cabinets filled with Japanese memorabilia such as of course, weapons, samurai armor on stands, tea sets and dishes, some wind and stringed musical instruments, and clothing. A huge king sized bed occupied the center of the room with tan pillows and a tiger print blanket. No presence of his sensei here and with that he closed the door.

“Maybe they left a note on the fridge?” he said out loud as he went out of the hallway and back into main lair to where the kitchen was to the left of the hall entrance.
He looked onto the chrome steel fridge to see a couple of coupons for Pizza Palace and a couple of phone numbers on sticky notes belonging to friends and acquaintances, but no note whatsoever explaining his family’s absence.

“How come they didn’t leave a note on where they were going? And why did they leave out little old me? *Sigh. This definitely bites!” he said to himself with an expression of dismay. Though his face had a more uplifting expression after a realization had hit him.

“I have the lair all to myself! I could do whatever I want!” he yelled as he lifted his arms in a triumphant pose.

Being alone in the lair was a rare scenario indeed since the family hides out in the sewers mostly during the day unless major trouble was brewing up on the surface like alien invasions, Shredder, and whatnot. So now he decided to take full advantage of the situation and just have personal free Mikey time to himself all day. He was still concerned about them and their disappearance, but he then shrugged it off slightly, lessening the seriousness of it. Besides, they’ll be back eventually and it’s not like they have forgotten me or anything. They’re probably off doing something not too serious and most likely boring too. he thought to himself.

"Now what to do? What to do...?"

What happens next?

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Tabletop RP(T)G Travel

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
It was a clear autumn day in NYC on the usual crowded market district and a mutant turtle dressed in heavy winter attire from a brown wool cap and scarf to a puffy orange parka and mitts to brown slacks and boots, his disguise on the surface world.

He wanted to get some fresh air as well as visiting the local comic book shops for anything new. As he passed a few clothing outlets and locally own restaurants, he came across a store that he haven’t seen before in the area wedged between a burger joint and a coat shop. What is strange about the shop was that it looked like a gnarled tree stump with the outside wooden corners twisted upward and the bottom corners seemed to be rooted to the ground quite literally. The color of the shop also stood out as it was a pitch black hue. And top it all off was the shop’s name: Madam Mirage’s Curios Collection. Stranger still was Mikey felt an ominous chill down his back just by looking at it.

Though it still made him the more curious about the place and went in. He opened the door and was startled by the ringing bell on the door frame. He looked around and saw the store owner at the register counter on the left. The store owner was a little old white-haired lady that wore a full bodied purple cloak and wide brim hat and a bit of a hunchback.

She didn’t really spoke to him or greeted with a ‘hello’ but did a small serving gesture with her arm that told Mikey to look around the store as much as he liked. Mikey just nodded silently at the gesture as he started to navigate through the oak shelf maze alone.

He looked at the many strange items that filled the shelves: tarot cards, crystal balls, strange statues for fertility reasons, weird stones and gems, and some books about ancient magic and monsters. However, one item had caught his attention, a turquoise box that is called Enchanted Realms: An Out-of-this-World Table Top RPG. He picked it up and examined the box a bit more, but oddly enough there didn’t seem to be any pictures or other labels on the other sides of the box. It really intrigued him and he have spectated such table top games at some conventions but didn’t really participate. He always wanted to see what it was like to play something like this. Sure, he may have played plenty of online MMORPGs, but the majority of those have become repetitive, linear and too much pay-to-win/plays with the amount of features and customizations locked with a price. Speaking of price, Mikey looked at the price tag on the shelf.

“Only 7 bucks?!” he quietly exclaimed.

Most retail, cons and comic shops had these for over 20 bucks. This was a definite steal!

After some thought, he decided to get it. He took the box and headed over to register counter. He gave the old lady the money and waved bye to her as he left the store.

He went a few blocks and into a nearby alleyway between two apartment buildings. He approached a manhole near a chain linked fence and opened it to go in it without anyone noticing.

He navigated through the NY sewer system, taking the necessary turns back to the lair. After entering the lair grounds, he walked pass the living room the area with the multiple TV screens and monitors and the entertainment system with video game consoles, the kitchen area where Leo and Donnie were eating some left over pizza, and Raph working out with dumbbells in the mini-gym across from the kitchen.

He greeted them quickly and went down the hall pass in between them where the turtles’ rooms were. To the right of the hallway were both Don’s and Mikey’s rooms with Leo’s and Raph’s on the opposite side. He opened and went through the door that was to the right of Don’s and slammed it shut behind him.
He set the bag down in the middle of his room. A room with a shelf that occupied the left corner wall ; the top having filled with some robot figurines and futuristic vehicle models from some anime and the bottom having an archive of superhero and detective comic books collected over the years. There was also a twin-size bed covered in blue sheets next to that, a closet that held most of his clothes and disguises, a desk with a computer monitor on it with the CPU on the floor, and a small TV on a long and wide dresser drawer hooked up to an entertainment system with video game consoles and Blu-Ray and DVD players.

After taking off his disguise and putting it away, he went back to the box and removed it from the bag and opened it to reveal its contents. There were the basics; the multi-sided dices of twenty along with dice with ATK, MAG, SPD, INT and DEF on them, a pad of character creation sheets, number 2 pencils, a Dungeon Master mat, and a small manual that explained the rules briefly. There was a map that was oddly rolled up in the side that opened like a treasure map. It was pretty big and had a grid, but Mikey was surprised in the detail that went into it. There were towns and cities with medieval stylings with castles and temples, deep valleys and gorges with names like Quillan and Losglad that had strange looking animals, capes and lagoons that had small images of mermaids and selkies, dark forests with gnarled trees and small carnivorous plant creatures and treants, regular looking forests with images of fairies, dwarves and deer, dark caverns teeming with insectoid like creatures and golems, and treacherous mountain ranges with some having volcanos having molten lavamen, trolls, centaurs/minotaurs and orcs.

Mikey then read parts of the manual to see what kind of story this world had to offer. The gist of it is the hero(es)’ quest is to retrieve the Orion Sword and Scepter that have been taken by Torvak and his orc and troll army and the insectoid queen Narvisa, respectively. The hero(es) have to travel far and wide in the land to gain experience, weapons, artifacts and allies along the way to help out in the quest and vanquish the foes and even do side missions too. It seemed understandable and standard enough like most RPGs out there, nothing out of the ordinary.

He also read about the races that exist in this fantasy world. Humans, elves, and dwarves were a given and were some neutral factions of orcs and dark elves too. Then there were the Beastmen, a variety of anthropomorphic animals. There were beastmen based on rhinos, warthogs, elephants, bears, wolves, foxes, and to his surprise, turtles too! Even had pictures of these turtlemen that look uncannily like him and his brothers. There were even dinosaur beastmen and the ones based on triceratops look way too similar to the Triceratons.

“Whoa, weird and freaky.” It was all he could say.

He basically skimmed through the rest that explained the rules of the game including stats, upgrades, dungeon types, dice functions, etc. and started to focus his attention on the character sheets, wanting to get into it. He filled out as much as he could. His name was kept the same as Michelangelo. He put in Beastmen: Turtle on the line next to race and placed Male on the Gender line. He then reached the Class/Job line and pondered to think about it. He went back to the manual to look over the class/job suggestions.

There was a list of starter class suggestions that can be upgraded to new classes when able to get enough skills and experience. Of course, these were suggestions and that customizable classes were optional too.

Warrior – Well-balanced armored fighter that excels ATK and DEF and wields both short and long swords and shields.

Thief – Stealthy master in the art of stealing that boosts in SPD than any other class. Prefers daggers and and knives able to steal valuables from monsters, pickpocket citizens and uses lock picks on treasure chests.

Wizard – A mage with high INT and MAG stats that manipulates the elements: fire, lightning, ice, water, earth. Uses rods and wands as weapons.

Cleric – Practitioner in the holy arts that cures the party of ailments and heals HP; high in INT and MAG. Uses staffs as weapons.

Monk – A martial artist whose lethal weapons are bare fists and uses Chi to initiate martial art techniques. High in ATK power and close quarters combat.

Archer – Master in ranged combat and skilled with bows and arrows with great SPD. Can be able to equip knives for close combat when limited on arrows.

Quite a list of available jobs to choose from and then again, he can create his own too. After some pondering, Mikey decided on his class choice.

What job is it?
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Campaign Start!

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content: What job is it?
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Thief?

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
A thief is close to a ninja, Mikey thought. Not to mention high in speed and agility stats, 50% more loot for every monster fought, and the lock picking for treasure chests and rooms. It seemed like a really good and fitting class too.

After choosing his class, he filled the rest of the character sheet and then he was ready to start the game.

“Start the game by rolling the Dimension Dice.”

He grabbed the odd 6 sided dice where on each side was just a navy blue dot. They didn’t seem to have any significance or any practical function to start the game. But he just went with it either way.

He shook the dice in his hand and rolled them on the map. When they stopped, the spots on the dice started to simultaneously flash a bright light. Then, the dice floated into the air and started spinning really fast, creating a tornado in the process.

Mikey was in awe at the events unfolding. However, he began to panic as he felt himself getting sucked into the gradually powerful whirlwind. He grabbed to hold of something but couldn’t as he gets pulled in. Then, a blue portal appeared just right over the map where Mikey was dragged into.

“WHOOOAAAA!”

Mikey yelled as he fell into an electric blue tunnel with what appear to be glowing ancient letters or runes on the walls. It wasn’t long until he saw the light at the end and then blackouts.

“Ungh….”

After a few minutes, Mikey groaned as his eyes flittered opened and adjusted them to their new scenery.

Where is Mikey now?

"Ungh...." Mikey groaned.

His eyes fluttered open, greeted by the light from the torches that occupied the clay colored walls and the campfire next a few feet from him. He could see a rack of weapons to his left that held a large axe, a great sword, giant mace, a large scythe, spiked club and a war hammer. To his right were a couple of plain wooden chests and in front of him was a tunnel with a light at the end, leading into the unknown.

"Wha...the shell?" he mumbled, noticing that he was on top of some kind of sleeping bag made out of buffalo hide. But that wasn't the only thing he noticed when looking down. "AH! My shell! What happened to my shell?"

His shell and plastron were completely gone, exposing his green skin as well as his dick and balls. He covered them up with his hands out of reflex.

"I'm...I'm in the game? No way!" he exclaimed.

He looked towards the possible exit down the tunnel, but he wouldn't dare go out in his birthday suit. His attention went to the chests to the right of the cavern room. Maybe it had something for him to wear?

He opened one of the chest to reveal...

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: The Make Out Mandate

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"COWABUNGA!" shouted the orange donning turtle ninja as he did sick tricks on his skateboard beneath the sewers.

The geared up Mikey did flip tricks, ollies and other techniques along the pipes and underground walkways.

"Whoa~!"

His ride came to an abrupt halt as his skateboard hit a square object on the concrete, making him crash. Good thing his gear protected him from any injuries other than a slight daze.

“Ugh…. always remember to wear your helmet kids…Ugh”

He got up and dusted himself off and checked on his skateboard. No scratches or any damage, good. But what did he hit and trip over? He looked back and checked to see a square box shaped object inside a black trash bag. There was a sticky note saying “Don’t Touch! Cursed!” attached on top. Out of curiosity, he took the box and uncovered the black tinted bag to reveal a purplish pinkish hue. The box read “The Make Out Mandates” in great big navy blue letters with the symbols for male and female intertwining with one another. More words that were found continued to describe the box’s contents, “The board game for adults 18+! Sexy steamy shenanigans with twists abound! Up to 4 or more players! At least, one female required to play.”

A weird find to say the least and looked harmless enough so he didn’t really get why the note saying that it was cursed. Don’t know why but he thought it might be something he brothers might see. So he got back on his skateboard and headed back to the lair.

“Hey dudes, you’re here?”

He was greeted with silence when he gotten back to the lair. He went over to the red couch and sat down in front of the TV monitors and entertainment system with a DVD/Blu-Ray player and some consoles. He set the box on the rectangular table and removed the contents and set the game up.

“Captain’s log….Stardate….Uh, Tuesday something? Space, the final frontier! And it’s boring! We haven’t seen a planet in a long while!”

An orange clad turtle complained with his feet on the delicate control panel with squared buttons and futuristic switches and dials. His gazing into the vast starry emptiness of space from the spaceship bridge’s wide window.

“Would ya quit the complainin’?” a red clad turtle shouted from a control panel similar across from him. “We had to get the shell out of dodge from the planet or else the Triceratons would have had our tails by now.”

“Raph is right Mikey. We didn’t have much choice. I’m sure we might find something sooner or later. Patience is a valuable thing, isn’t that what Master Splinter taught us?” The purple clad one called Donatello spoke from the main panel of the ship overlooking the other two and the rest of bridge. Silence held the room for a couple of minutes until Don spoke up again to the short android right next to him.

“So, Professor Honeycutt, do you have any idea where we are?”

“Not really, but a quick scan from the ship’s sensors can pinpoint are current area and anything nearby from miles away.” He said as he pressed many buttons on the control panel.

Suddenly, a humming can be heard throughout the ship as a green light in a grid surrounded the ship before quickly expanded outwardly in the vastness of space in the flash.

Just then, the door behind Don and Fugitoid slid open, Star Trek style.

“Hey, what was that just now?” the team leader turtle, Leonardo said as he went in.

“We’re just getting a clue onto our current location and where to go from here, Leonardo.” The android replied. Just then the radar kicked in as the giant monitor in front of him, displaying a green grid with the ship in the center and a small red blip in far upper right corner.

“Professor, what is it?” Don asked. “Don’t know. Doing a thorough analysis now.” he replied as he typed on the panel.

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Apartment Complexity - While patrolling the streets solo from the rooftops, Mikey comes across an abandoned boarded up apartment. Feeling adventurous and out of boredom, he sneaks in for some exploring, not knowing the consequences of doing so.
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Apartment Complexity

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
It was nighttime in NYC as the orange clad ninja turtle equipped with nunchaku and a shell-phone hopped from rooftop to rooftop with athletic finesse. Looking down from the edge onto the crowded streets below.

“Yaaawwwn…”

Nothing was really happening in terms of any kind of criminal activity. No signs of Foot Clan or Purple Dragons doing shady criminal business. Not even the usual mugging from petty thieves were present. It was getting boring to say the least. He wished he was back home playing some video games and reading comics and going to bed.

After hopping a few buildings, something caught his attention from across the street. A red brick five story rundown abandoned apartment building with boarded up windows where some were broken. A wide small cement staircase of a few steps leads to a door covered with many kinds of papers from evictions to No Trespassing to warrants.

However, there was a faint dim light that peaked through the boards of the left window on the ground floor. What might be making that light in a condemned place like that, he wondered? Could there be someone inside? Might as well check it out. Better than doing nothing all night.

With stealthy quickness, he managed to cross the street by jumping from streetlights and poles until he ducked into the alleyway on left of the building so he wouldn’t be seen. He peeked in the boarded-up window to see what was inside. No one seemed to be present. Maybe they left? Might be an ambush? How would they know that he be there exactly?

Still he prepared himself as he equipped his nunchaku and removed one of the boards so he can get into the building. Then, with a dodge roll, he jumped inside and struck a battle pose while swinging his nunchaku.

“Cowabun-!…Huh?”

He stopped his battle cry to find that no one was there. The lobby was completely empty save for a few dusty chairs on the wall opposite of him and a unisex bathroom. To his left, there was an L shaped reception desk with some boxes of office junk behind the counter on the floor and barren key hooks on the wall. Adjacent to that was a wall with built-in mailboxes.

But what grabbed his attention was the source of light he’d seen earlier. A dusty and cobwebbed covered desk lamp that was lit. With how old that it looked, it seemed impossible that it would be functioning. Where is the source of electricity from anyway? Stranger still is what the light was shining beneath it, revealing a key to one of the apartments.

Mikey went over and picked up the key. The key belonged to an apartment room on the ___ floor.

Which floor was it?
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Yes

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Which floor was it?
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Other

1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
The key had the number 305 etched into it, meaning it was for the third floor. Strange that it would be the only key that is here while noticing the empty key hook wall. Curiosity got his mind reeling on what could be up in that room and wanted to check it out. He grabbed it and proceeded to go up to the third floor.

Since the building didn’t have an elevator, he had to use the stairwell that was in the back of the lobby. After the long walk upstairs, he managed to reach the third floor. The hallway stretched long with its puke green striped walls and its dark blue carpeting.

‘301… 302… 303… 304… Aha, 305!’ he thought.

He found himself in front of the apartment door which the key belongs to with 305 in bronze. He put the key in the hole and unlocked it. He grabbed the knob and turned it, anticipating what could be waiting for him inside. He swung it opened.

What was inside?
1532222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: 3rd floor

info.brief_description: A TMNT TG Interactive all about Michelangelo. Based on the 2003 TMNT series.
info.description:
This is an interactive story about the most fun-loving and carefree of the turtles, Michelangelo, and his walk into the feminine side.

Some rules to establish:

1. No death or killing off chars
2. It is a mostly TG story, but anything else can be allowed except for vore (unbirthing is allowed), scat/watersports, and WG.
3. Others can join in too, but keep it centered around Mikey
4. Sex is allowed. No gay/lesbianism.
5. Have fun!
